Body.Content:
Microsoft Loop is a co-creation app which enables you and your team to bring all the parts of your project together in one place and collaborate across the apps and devices you already use.

We're excited to share that the Loop mobile app now supports Intune app protection policies. This update applies to both iOS and Android apps.

[When this will happen:]

Available now

[How this will affect your organization:]

Starting in November, the Microsoft Loop app will be available to target in the Intune console and can be added under All Apps or All Microsoft Apps. To target a policy to only Loop, select the Select public apps option and select Loop.

You can manually target it today through the Intune console:

  • Selecting Selected apps in the Target policy to dropdown box
  • Click Select custom apps to select custom apps to target based on Microsoft Loop Package ID: com.microsoft.loop

[What you need to do to prepare:]

There is nothing required to prepare for this update.

For more details on how to target apps with your app protection policy, see:

  • How to create and assign app protection policies
  • How to: Require app protection policy and an approved client app for cloud app access with Conditional Access

Note that some features, such as Certificate Pinning, are not supported yet.

You might want to notify your users about this new app. Your users can install the Microsoft Loop mobile app through the iOS App Store or Android Play Store.

Title: Intune support for the Microsoft Loop mobile app
